intro: Spermacoce capitata, commonly known as the spurred morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and is part of the Convolvulaceae family. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, climbing stems. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Spermacoce capitata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
